To the chief Musician upon Mahalath, Maschil, <FI>A Psalm<Fi> of David. The fool hath said in his heart, <FI>There is<Fi> no God. Corrupt are they, and have done abominable iniquity: <FI>there is<Fi> none that doeth good.
God looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were <FI>any<Fi> that did understand, that did seek God.
Every one of them is gone back: they are altogether become filthy; <FI>there is<Fi> none that doeth good, no, not one.
Have the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people <FI>as<Fi> they eat bread: they have not called upon God.

There were they in great fear, <FI>where<Fi> no fear was: for God hath scattered the bones of him that encampeth <FI>against<Fi> thee: thou hast put <FI>them<Fi> to shame, because God hath despised them.<RF>were…: Heb. they feared a fear<Rf>

Oh that the salvation of Israel <FI>were come<Fi> out of Zion! When God bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, <FI>and<Fi> Israel shall be glad.<RF>Oh that…: Heb. Who will give salvation, etc<Rf><CM>
